reviews.text: Great, fast, and friendly. Everything you could ask for in a perfect pizza and sandwich shop. There pizza is excellent and you must have there mozzarella sticks, they are larger than life. My favorite is there chicken parmigiana sub.

The food came 20 minutes faster than anticipated, which was a bonus. The mozzarella sticks we're great! However, the Florentine pizza was a great big soggy nasty mess. So much so it turned my stomach and couldn't eat it. Which is disappointing, especially considering I ordered an extra large. 😒

Ordered an hour before my break at work. After an hour and a half later I called and was forced to cancel my order. Wasn’t going to pay,  for wilted food. Not to mention...  my lunch break was over and was starving anyhow so why bother. Like , the order was salad 🥗 . How long to make that and deliver 10 minutes down the road . Just saying!!!!
Delicious calzones and large portions for your money.

Ordered a meatball pizza a few Sunday's ago... The crust and cheese was great. The sauce was ehh and meatballs didn't taste like homemade meatballs it even looked weird. 
It looked like someone bought frozen meatballs at Stop & Shop, heated them up on the microwave and broke each meatball into 100 pieces with their fingers and threw it in the oven.
Woke up the next morning with food poisoning that felt like an excruciating painful stomach bug. 
I may try this place one more time but if something like this happens again I'll not come back

Loved all of the accompanying dishes so you can create your own flavor combos. We got there just in time, around 6:30 before the mobs of people started to arrive around 7. The service was terrific, fast, warm smiles and the staff all had a collective effort. Be sure to say hi to the owner/host, he was the nicest guy and you can tell he took pride in his restaurant. We’ll definitely be back, but next time we’re trying the bbq table :) 

Also - be sure to get the chicken dumplings to start

It was good but I wouldn't say that it was stellar and I would come back. The food was average and the place is definitely historic. They need to up their game given there are many other fantastic korean good food options in Austin now. The place is a little hard to find as it is tucked away near a small Chinese Zen garden. The service was okay and took a while. We requested a few things but didn't get it on time. We had to ask the waiter multiple times. The interior was a little dim and bland. The tofu soup was really great though, not so sure about the cold noodles. It is worth a one time try but I can't fully recommend it as a too option, there are a lot other better ones.
We got Korean BBQ combo and everything was amazing! Great atmosphere, very helpful staff. Loved it!!
Have been coming here for ten years plus. Never a bad experience! Great atmosphere, and wonderful people.

Always great. They have cleaned, updated and renovated the place. They also performed a menu update after the previous owner, who was also the sushi chef, retired. No more sushi is a bummer. Also, my favorite dish consisting of stir fried baby octopus is gone. I was initially sad that my favorite dish was gone but it forced me to try something new and I was not let down! They were busy for lunch and all the diners seemed content. I will always come back.

Incredible sushi spot- 5 stars doesn’t do this place justice. It’s probably the best sushi I’ve ever had including on trips to Japan, and all around the world. This place is incredible. If you want the classic experience, this is the place.
This place is amazing. From the B-dama and Delage family. I out this up there with maruya and kenzo
Experience places the food at its center, as it should be.  Great time!
Excellent sushi, well presented. Place is quite cold (I don't mean temperature) and unadorned, not warm or cozy in the least.

I've never gone to a place like this before, and it was definitely an amazing and unique experience. Each bite of food is different and full of flavor, and the atmosphere is also great. Sorry for taking photos!
Salad bowl bar! I visited twice in a row. 110　pesos for the small bowl and it comes with healthy veg-fruit mix juice.

Always order from uber eats. Great salads! maybe a little on the pricey side, but they are worth it. Fresh, flavorful and they offered me free extra toppings one time they run out of ingredients. Mango dressing is my favorite! Recommended!
Kind staff. I do not speak Spanish. The staff taught me the Spanish names for the salad ingredients.

The place is always clean, sometimes the staff aren't in sight and take a long time to respond, but the food is good(a little expensive in my humble opinion), it's also a little cold inside the restaurant

reviews.author_name: P L A T A r q
reviews.text: Buen servicio. Buen lugar. Recomendado 100%
It was really good. better than Colorado springs McDonald's.. Everything was fresh thank you

The coke machine is always broken, service is crapy, and the wait is not worth the food. You could go somewhere for better food and get it faster. If you are in a rush go somewhere else, this place is not worth it. To top it all off it is not kid friendly anymore. They have electronic devices that don’t even work half the time. I went once and a baby got run over by a high chair. NOT kid friendly at all.
My weakness! Always a crowd but worth the wait. This location one of the cleanest for being so busy.
Wow looks really nice, so modern, good customer service and they have some good deals.

Nasty food..filthy restaurant .. I am so fed up with the sorry excuse for customer service. I came in today and ordered chicken nuggets, no dipping sauce but 2 packs of mayo, they charged me for the mayo, then tried to give me someone elses food. after they handed my food to the car in front of me, they gave me the same food without replacing it. This place is a horrible location. I will never go back to this location. The sad thing is the owners could care less.

St. John’sChurch is one of the oldest medieval architectural monuments in Latvia. Church was built in the beginning of 13th century during the Christianization of Baltic’s for the purposes of the Livonian Holy Order because residence of the order was located in Cēsis; therefore Cēsis became one of the most important German power centers in the Baltic’s from 1237 up to 1561

Pretty, very old, church with a terrifying (fun) option to tour the bell tower. The church is pretty, but let's be honest - all churches from that era are. For mere 2€ you can take your life in your hands and climb the stairs of the ~65m bell tower for a view. Most of the thrill comes from navigating the near-black steep staircase on your way up. Still, I enjoyed it.
A good place

The church facade still awaits restoration, but the community seems to be very active. The guide, a senior lady, is very vigorous, helpful and gave lots of information, as did the exhibitions inside. The tombs of the Masters of the Livonian Order and the stained glass with the Latvian coat of arms, which was miraculosly preserved by the pastor during the Soviet time are impressive.
Nice church, nothing special.

J ai découvert cet établissement par hasard, étonnant, typique avec sa bâtisse créole. Belle salle de restaurant avec des menus locaux de qualité, produits frais. Accueillant et sympathique. Je recommande vivement.

Restaurant testé un samedi soir pour 6 personnes (dont 4 touristes). Service très souriant et accueillant. Les cocktails et plats sont très bons, bien exécutés. Il y a eu qqes petites erreurs pendant le service mais rien de gênant car le personnel est réactif (manque couverts, eau pas fraîche, attente glaçons). Très bonne découverte à Cayenne.

Très bon moment avec des plats délicieux ! Service et accueil de qualité et chaleureux !
Très propre
Carte au top avec du goût et des saveurs ! Le poisson est délicieux !
Établissement a recommander !
Attention par contre a la petite boule rouge sur le riz dans le moqueca, c'est un piment de cayenne et non une tomate cerise ! Sinon réchauffement supplémentaire garanti !

Excellent déjeuner avec un service et un cadre très agréables! Nous avons profité du menu du jour : gratiné de crabe, moqueca de poisson et panna cotta combawa. Oups je n'ai pris que l'entrée en photo... Merci pour ce délicieux moment et à très vite!

Très belle expérience!

Un lieu agréable dans belle maison créole et sa petite cours

L’ambiance y est bonne et le choix variée 

Une carte totalement refaite pour un style gastronomique.

Le service est professionnel avec des serveurs attentifs (meme un peu trop)

Une très bonne collection de rhum vieux pour les digestifs.

De préférence réservez pour bénéficier de l’étage.
Had plenty of Thai food over the years but I have to say mai thai is absolutely amazing. So authentic, so much flavour and cooked to perfection. Definitely be back. Wayne from South Wales 👍
It was delicious, we had the set meal for two, just about managed to eat it all. The waitress was friendly and helpful and the service was really good.

I'm really sad to say our visit to Mai Thia was very disappointing. We had a set meal. Our starters we lovely but we had a 'soup' and main dishes were basically tasteless except for the beef dish which had an overpowering aniseed flavour. Lemongrass had been chopped into the dishes therefore every mouthful you had, you were picking the hard lemongrass out. I did mention to the waitress this wasn't to my liking but she said that's what Thia food is like! The dessert was banana fritters, and like the starter thus was nice. I love Thia food and have had the pleasure of eating in a few Thia restusrants but Mai Thia really has a different take on This food!! If this was your first experience of Thia food, I don't think you would want to eat Thia again.
Wonderful food and service, plus free parking outside.
Lovely authentic Thai restaurant. Friendly staff, generous portions, great food. Nice laid-back vibe -- a lovely neighbourhood restaurant.
I love the buffet here. Nice variety of food and the staffs are also helpful. They serve good variety of Nepalese and Indian cuisine.

Good food. Not all the dishes are very authentic but all dishes are good. Ideal restaurant for ones who are new to Indian cuisine as most of the food can be altered suit your taste buds. Food quality is good and worth the money you are paying.

The chili chicken and the buttery chicken is the best. My second plate of the $14 buffet consisted of just those.  The goat was decent. The buffet selection was of medium size. There were some fried veggies and red BBQ chicken that looked spicy but wasn't.

Had a great dinner here! The server was friendly and attentive, the food was pretty good too. The chicken was dry which means it was overcooked or old, but our server made everything better by giving us a free dessert: a scrumptious rice pudding which was the best I've ever had, aside from Richshaw Republic in Lincoln Park. All in all, a great experience and I highly recommend. I'm only giving 4 stars because of the dry chicken. Otherwise, a great place in Evanston!
Awesome food and very accommodating staff. Would definitely visit again.
